data.title: "To All the Boys I've Loved Before": The Differences Between the Book and the Movie
meta_keywords: to all the boys i've loved before
to all the boys i've loved before book
to all the boys i've loved before movie
to all the boys ive loved before differences
to all the boys i've loved before changes
to all the boys i've loved before netflix
data.meta_description: The movie "To All the Boys I've Loved Before" is taking the internet by storm, but there are some differences in the movie from the hit book that it's based off of. Here's a deep dive into what didn't make it into the Netflix film.
data.text:
To All the Boys I've Loved Before has taken the world by storm and it certainly helps that it was a best-selling novel before it got turned into the hit movie we have all fallen in love with. Along with its two other sequels, the book series has become a New York Times best seller. But, as with every book adaptation, some scenes that you loved reading about might look a little different on screen.

Here are all the differences between the book and movie...

Why Kitty Sent Out the Letters

Kitty meant well when she sent out the letters in the movie. In an effort to help her sister find a good guy, she decided to send out all 5 letters in the hopes of getting Lara Jean a boyfriend. However, in the book, Kitty sent out the letters after Lara Jean found out about Kitty's crush on Josh. Before Lara Jean was able to tell Josh about it, Kitty decided to send out the letters as revenge.

The Mystery of Who Sent the Letters

For the majority of the book, it was honestly anyone's guess as to who sent out the letters. However, in the movie, it was pretty obvious that Kitty was the one who sent out the letters after she sneaked into the closet and looked at the hat box.

How Lara Jean and Peter First Interact

While Lara Jean and Peter clearly have history before their first scenes together, the way they first start to talk is completely different. In the book, Lara Jean has some car issues and Peter decides to help her out. In the movie, Lara Jean backs up and almost runs him over.

Peter's Letter Is Missing Something

Once all the letters get out, Peter tries to sort things out with Lara Jean and mentions a part of the letter that says he has golden specks in his eyes. While that's a super cute moment in the movie, it wasn't the same in the book as she wrote that he has an STD, something that was definitely not mentioned in the film.

Josh's Jeep vs. Audi

Peter Kavinski's silver Jeep was certainly Kitty-approved in the movie, but in the book he actually drove an Audi. However, when he started to pick up Kitty and Lara Jean before school, he decided to switch to his mom's minivan in order to fit everyone.

Why Josh is Jealous

In the book, it's pretty obvious that Josh has feelings from Lara Jean. He ends up getting jealous of her new relationship with Peter after he realizes his feeling for her. In the movie, it's not really clear why Josh hates Peter. It just seems like he's really protective of her because of their old friendship, although, it is kind of odd he just so happened to be outside during Lara Jean and Peter's big fight.

Lara Jean and Peter's First Kiss

In both the book and the movie, Lara Jean decides to kiss Peter in order to hide her crush on Josh. However, in the movie she kisses him in the middle of the track field once she sees Josh, who wants to ask her about the letter. In the book, she accidentally runs into Peter after Josh tries to confront her and she kisses him.

Why Peter Tries to Start the Secret Relationship

Gen is a major reason why Peter ends up getting into the secret relationship with Lara Jean, but it's completely different in the book than it is in the movie. In the film, he hopes it would help him get back with Gen after their breakup. In the book, he tries to use it in order to send a message to Gen that their relationship is over.

The Reason Behind their Big Fight

After their big hot tub film goes viral, Lara Jean and Peter break up in the film after she finds out that he went to Gen's room the same night. In the book, they end up breaking up after she thinks that he still loves Gen.

The Big Reveal of Who Shared the Hot Tub Video

In both the book and the movie, it's revealed that Gen was the one who shared the video. However, Peter and Lara Jean don't find out about it until the second book P.S. I Still Love You.

John Ambrose McClaren Showing Up

You might have missed this mid-credits scene where John Ambrose McClaren shows up at Lara Jean's doorstep with some flowers and her letter! Unfortunately, we didn't see what happened next in the movie. In the book, however, John Ambrose plays a big part in the sequel P.S. I Still Love You. Here's hoping we get a sequel so we can see that unfold!
